content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Postal 2 is exactly what you make of it. Yes, it can be a gruesome, unsavory, albeit cartoony, experience, and the game does push you to that end most of the time, but it can also be a open world game that allows you to explore a satirical world filled with both hilarious situations and expectations that speak volumes about paranoid, and in many ways complacent, mid-2000s America. In many ways, it shows how trivial the concerns of the time actually were in the grand scheme of things. Postal 2 needs to be given more credit for pushing the envelope for games; what was once considered taboo was torn apart and amplified in this game. Wholly recommended as an experience.

number of helpful: 434 of 497 people (87%) found this review helpful15 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 18, 2014
												The prequel to Animal Crossing (Orig. Doubutsu no Mori, released in 2001 for the Nintendo 64), Postal 2 is an experimental first look at how Animal Crossing would eventually expand. Explore a large, bustling town where each NPC has their own schedule, and you can perform menial-but-fun tasks in any way you wish. Featuring many food items, as well as the ability to use the signature 'shovel' item from Animal Crossing, this game has endless possibility for fun. Spend hours gathering all of certain kinds of items, just to say that you did! Fans of Animal Crossing will not be disappointed - I give this game an 11 out of Shigeru Miyamoto.

Posted: November 9, 2014
"I know what you're thinking, but the funny thing is, I don't even LIKE videogames..."Postal 2 is a insane first-person shooter that takes place in Paradise, Arizona, yet it's far from being a paradise.The StoryIn Postal you play as The Postal Dude, a tall thin man with a goatee, sunglasses, a blue alien t-shirt, and a long black leather coat. The story takes place throughout one week. Each day you complete mundane tasks created by your nagging wife. As the days go on the town gets progressively worse with protestors, terrorists, and even the undead.GameplayGameplay consists of first-person shooting with a handful variety of armaments. The difficulty scales from Liebermode to Really ♥♥♥♥ing Hard. On harder difficulties, health items are instantly used on pick-up and civilians will attack on site. This game features secret weapons and ammo giving you an advantage on what's to come. There's a plethora of achievements each consisting of a reference like Loverboy's song Everybody's Working for the Weekend and Modern Family[en.wikipedia.org]. Even though this game was created  back in April 13, 2003, the game still gets weekly updates from glorious Running With Scissors, and still can beat today's 'next-gen' games.Pros:Original StorylineComical murderStill gets updatesModsAchievementsReplay valueCons:Combat kinda feels mundaneSome glitchesNo co-op campaignCan't kill Mike J enoughSo, what are you waiting for? Buy the game!Toploader totally didn't force me to make this review. Help.

content:
Posted: October 1, 2014
												Do you like Postal 2? The first game was a little too Columbine for my tastes, but when Postal 2 came out in '03, I think the series really came into its own, commercially and artistically. The whole game has a clear, crisp level of violence, and a new sheen of consumerate decadence that really gives the mindlessness a big boost. It's been compared to Manhunt, but I think Postal has a far more sarcastic, cynical sense of humor.In '04, RWS released this, Apocalypse Weekend, their most insane content addon. I think their undisputed addition from this was the destruciton of Paradise, an ending so gratifying, most people don't pay attention to the message. But they should, because it's not just about the pleasures of destroying and moving on, and the importance of the post-Cold War era, it's also a personal statement about how Vince feels about the Middle East in general.HEY PAUL

content:
Posted: October 14, 2014
												I updated this dated review a bit for higher quality standards and updated informations. Also make sure to check out my little bit shorter Paradise Lost review.http://steamcommunity.com/id/xlucyferx666/recommended/360960/Postal 2.One of the best games I have ever played in my life.I mean it serious. I know this game for many years already and played definitely over 300 hours in it (CD & DVD Version). And now it came to Steam. This is the best thing that could have ever happened to it. I bought the game quite often in different editions like the Boxed Edition, Fudge Pack Edition and 10th Anniversary Edition. I also have some other items like a talking Krotchy doll.Its amazing how much work and heart the developers put into this game.It still gets updates 12 years after the actual release. Probably the longest supported game in history? Actually it wasnt updated for several years to be honest. It was quite around Postal for many years. Not even Postal 3 changed this fact, especially because it wasnt as good as the most people wanted it to be. It wasnt developed by RWS anyway. I think this game was ok but couldnt reach Postal 2 in any way. I personally do not recommend Postal 3 because its buggy and glitchy as hell. Maybe wait for some proper patches/mods one day...Now to the actual game review.In Postal 2 you play as The Postal Dude. One of my favorite game characters of all time. A man living with his wife in a motorhome in the city Paradise.You have to do normal things like buying stuff in the store or returning books to the mall. Or getting a christmas tree. Those sort of tasks you have to finish to progress in the game.But this isnt often as easy as we would wish. The crazy city Paradise comes always into our ways. The police, protestors, priests, god*amn even Osama wants us dead. But we can defend ourself and attack back with several weapons. One of the biggest weapon collections ever seen in a game. This Steam versions has even more than the old version. A lot of AWP and ED weapons have been added. Not all but many which doubles the fun. Pistols, shotgun, scissors to rocket launchers. We can also pee on everyone and everything. It was never easier to take a p*ss. Also the gore has been raised extremely. Now you have the same gore amount that was included in the addon Apocalypse Weekend, which is btw included. We can also grab our dog or cat to fight against the citizens but cats are mostly just useful to silence your guns. No, I'm not kidding. There are also other items ingame like "health pipes". Yeah, you know what I mean. In addition to that there are a lot of secrets and goodies ingame! The game is actually open world but with several levels that are only visitable on certain days. Yes the game has days. Monday to Sunday actually. The standard Postal 2 was Monday to Friday but the addon added Saturday and Sunday. You can play Monday to Friday or Saturday and Sunday or the whole week. Everything is possible when you start a new game. Oh and because we came to the start a new game part. There are so many difficulties! I cant remember such a big difficulty amount in any other game. No clue how many exactly there are but definitely over 10! Every of those difficulties offers a different game experience. From the people who hit you with shovels to people who shoot with rocket launchers at you and who are insulted already when you look at them. There is everything. I think that should be enough about the game itself.The game also has a multiplayer but I think most here wont care for it anyway, its not much played. Its not horrible but kinda outdated, but no wonder. There are still sometimes a few players to find.The game itself runs with the Unreal Engine 1.5 or 2 when im right. Some hybrid of it.So it means that this game is dated. If you await nice fancy graphics, you are at the wrong address. But the engine does what is should. It has also been updated with the latest patches released on Steam. Before Steam it was kinda unstable and crashed often. This problems are by now fixed. Also Steamworks has been integrated. Also archievements and trading cards. Workshop exists now too. So everything that a actual game needs, right?But there are so many fixes and changes by now, that I cant even say them all.Best to check out the store page. Incredible work by the devs!Well, what else should I say.Postal 2 has nothing really to do with Postal 1, yes I played this also.It was often criticized in the media and banned from a lot of countries due to its gore and seriousness. Doesnt hit everyones taste. I really feel the love the developers put into this game and Postal 2 is between my favorite games of all time. And this game list consists out of Crysis, Fallout etc. I often dare to think about Postal 2 being an Indie game, even if it is. I really love to see this game here on Steam. I bet it will never really die and also todays gamers will always have access to it. It is often on sale for a joke price so definitely a must have! By now there is even a new DLC which adds many hours of new gameplay. I will review this in a seperate review.Positives:- Big free roam map- Includes Apocalypse Weekend- Biggest amount of secrets ever- Unique in nearly every way- Great main character- Gary Coleman- Biggest arsenal of weapons ever- You can pee on everyone and everything- You can finish the game without any violence- GORE- Voice of Rick Hunter (Postal Dude)- Still support after 12 years- Many new features and fixes since Steam release- Osama is ALIVE- Realife Simulator!- Still working Multiplayer with a few players- New addon after 12 years, holy hell!- Steamworks integration, Workshop, MODS!- Best black humor ever in a videogameNegative:- Dated Graphics- Might not hit everyones tasteReplayability: Very HighMy score? 9.5/10Many people may dont understand this rating but thats just how it is.This game really serves as a love letter to fans. I never recall any other developer to put so much work, especially after so many years, into a game.Postal 2 was between one of my first PC games, no crap.For me this game is unique how it is and cant be compared to any other game.And another part, I just felt like I have to add it...THANK YOU Running With Scissors for making this amazing game for us.And even keeping up the support, releasing patches and even a whole new DLC!This is simply so amazing. This is the reason why I think Running With Scissors is the best developer ever. No kidding. Nobody else puts so much work into a loved videogame franchise!Its stuff like that, that I would wish from other developers. There are so many games by now that just wasted to dust and often doesnt even run properly anymore. I dont think it would be so hard to release hotfixes for them. But 90% of all devs dont do this.

number of helpful: 87 of 95 people (92%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 12, 2014
												Intentionally ironic and satirical, Postal 2 picks up where its predecessor left off – as a game that, while highly controversial, is loads of fun.If you have a twisted sense of humor, if you hate cats and enjoy South Park, Beavis and Butthead, Jackass or any of those other guilty pleasures then you will certainly find plenty to smile about while exploring Paradise.A nonstop tour de force of insulting insanity. And even though I should be disgusted by the potty humor and derogatory caricatures, I had a blast playing through it. Postal 2 just cries out for multiplayer, particularly when you can lay down a snaking path of gasoline for half a block and light it up; what a way to trap and kill your local or online friends! Alas, it's not there.I can take points away from the game for many things, but none of these things really detract from the fun that you can have with this game. The game is about one thing, and one thing only - fun. And it delivers.

number of helpful: 87 of 98 people (89%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
												Have you ever had one of 'those' days?This is THE violent video game. This game was one of many others that parents all across the United States wanted banned so that their children wouldn't have their eyes spoiled by its horrific imagery. Now you can experience all of its excessive, abhorrent content on Steam.First of all let me say that this game is a personal favorite of mine. I had played it at a friend's place way back and loved it, but never had a chance to buy it. So when I saw that it was on Greenlight I thought 'Hey, why not?' and gave it an enthusiastic thumbs up. The day it released I bought it, pretty excited to experience it again nearly a decade later. I was not disappointed. This game has aged considerably well, considering it was made in 2003. However, its age does show.Pros:+The gameplay, controls, and combat are tight. Being how old this game is, there was no dime-a-dozen cover mechanics or regenerating health, so strafing, bunny-hopping, and repeatedly crouching up and down behind low cover while firing are some tactics that work. Reloading is for losers and newbies, so feel free to waste all three-hundred shots of your AR15.+The comedy of this game hasn't lost its humor. Being an over exaggerated parody of life in the United States during 2003, a lot of the jokes made still hold water to this day. Overbearing banks, corrupt priests, trigger-happy cops, stereotypical Islamic terrorists, religious cults, cannibals,♥♥♥♥♥♥y rednecks, people simply not giving a damn, the whole shebang viewed and commentated from the eyes of a sarcastic cynic just trying to get through a pretty hectic week.+Techincally, this game is pretty stable and has some interesting features. I haven't seen any game-breaking bugs, but I have had a crash or two. If you ever get stuck somewhere in the world (which is bound to happen considering it's a free-roaming sandbox) the game teleports you to a nearby spot free of charge. There are also some small pieces of unimportant mechanics that are superflorus but fun. Exploring around is rewarded with interesting to downright strange results. Attaching a cat to your barrel to suppress your weapon is a neat but useless feature. Placing a donut on the ground and taking a leak on it will have an interesting outcome. Speaking of which, this game still has the best urine physics I've ever seen in a game... oddly enough.+A large, open world to explore and wreak havoc in.+A multiplayer, though I don't know how active it is.Cons:-The gameplay feels old. You've probably seen or played a game that had similar combat to this and that may be a downside to you. The gameplay isn't also 'realistic'. So no aiming down the sights or jelly on your face when you get shot.-The comedy of this game will turn off a lot of people, considering how carebear people have gotten on the internet lately. If you are easily offended by racial stereotypes, large amounts of cursing, ultraviolence, animal abuse, graphic vomitting and urination, homophobia, whatever, then this game is definitely not for you; stick to Gone Home, that will probably be more your speed.-Quite short, with a very simple story so if you are looking for a 'cinamatic adventure' you should probably look elsewhere.All in all, I recommend this game if just for a single playthrough. You want a numbered score? 8/10.I regret nothing.

number of helpful: 106 of 126 people (84%) found this review helpful16 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 17, 2014
												This is the game that all anti-video game politicians are referring to when they're spewing rhetoric about violent video games, whether they know it or not. POSTAL 2 is a delightful sandbox FPS where the only real goal is to finish your daily To-Do Lists.Now, you CAN simply walk directly to the supermarket, pick up some milk, pay the cashier, and leave; OR you could slaughter your way there, steal the milk, kill everyone in the building, and then urinate on their corpses - it's 100% up to you. For the most part, the game's tagline is correct: "It's only as violent as you are," but there are definitely some parts of the game where you *have* to absolutely kill everything in sight to survive.Oh also in the Apocalypse Weekend expansion you get to go Gallagher on some mad cows with a sledgehammer - definitely one of the best parts of the game, second only to the Tourettes Zombies.This is a game that should be in EVERYONE'S library, because it's the perfect game for letting off some steam. ♥♥♥♥♥♥ day at the office? Go blow up some elephants. Proffessor giving you a hard time in class? Set fire to a marching band. About to shoot up your workplace because you just absolutely can't take it anymore? Please don't, and instead take your anger out on hallucinations of mutated, nightmarish Gary Colemans (also, seek therapy).This game is a bit over 10 years old, but the magnificent mother ♥♥♥♥ers at Running With Scissors are rad enough that they've continued to update it with numerous patches, additional content, workshop support, and achievement support.9/10 only because 10/10 is reserved for Half Life 3.Oh and ♥♥♥♥ Uwe Boll.

number of helpful: 97 of 114 people (85%) found this review helpful9 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 31, 2014
												This is definitely one of those games you're either going to love, or you're going to absolutely hate.It's a cult classic and almost a straight parody of the late 90s and early 2000s "Videogames make people violent" debates popular of those times. At the time of it's release there was no other game as politically incorrect, dark and downright disturbing as this and... I love it.As an Australian it was even banned here until the R-18+ classification was granted for videogames so the only way to get it back then was to buy it off the Running With Scissors website, which I did and never regretted.Postal 2 is like a B grade movie that knows it's a B-grade movie, it's presentation is dodgy, the writing can use a lot of work but you just adore it anyway. It's humor is great if you like dark humor, it's a great sandbox and the game is even quite a challenge if you push yourself into the harder difficulties.The gameplay is average.The guns and gunplay are extremely poor.The AI is either extremely stupid, or downright unfair.The Graphics, even for it's time were weak.The map design is lack-lusterThe sound design and music is extremely average.Despite all this, Postal 2 is still one of the greatest games I've ever bloody played.And for the $10 steam is asking, you don't really have anything to lose. You at least owe it to yourself to try one of the most, if not THE most controversial game ever made.

Posted: November 2, 2014
												This game is more than a sandbox game. It's a simulator of a worker who goes postal. That last statement is actually false. You can choose to go through the whole game WITHOUT going postal. So its more of a game of right or wrong. Other than that lets start the review.This game is always being updated so don't worry about that. They usually release a update around a holiday such as halloween 2014. In the halloween 2014 update instead of terrorists there are SPOOKY SCARY SKELETONS THAT COME FROM THE GATES OF HELL (and yes I literally mean they come from the gates of hell). With the steam workshop feature there is a infinite amount of things you can do in postal 2. So this is classified as a open world, fps, sandbox game. If you were to relate this to garry's mod than you're completly wrong. This game is nothing like garry's mod. If you were to relate it GTA you'd still be wrong and besides GTA is third person anyway :special:. Postal 2 is its own kind of game. It's one of a kind and there will truely be nothing like this for decades to come. Hell, Postal 3 couldn't even compete with Postal 2. I'd say the closest a game got to postal 2 would be goat simulator. It goes on the same principle as postal 2. You can choose to act like a normal goat or go around rampaging the city. See how the two are alike? But, still, the two games are completly different.Who said you going postal was a bad thing? You can go and destroy terrorist organizations, Protest/deal with protesters, etc. Or you can go on a rampage with cat silencers and bombs and gasoline. That works too.I would reccomend you to buy this game ASAP. It's worth every penny.

content:
Posted: January 22, 2016
												Game name: Postal 2 Game score: 9.5/10Reviewed by: WolfIn Summary...Postal 2 is the successor to the contraversial series, Postal, which hit the stores on April 12, 2003. The story features The Postal Dude, or just Dude for short, and his adventures across the week doing various errands. Things more than often turn hasty, leaving a simple chore of "picking up milk" into slaying some Al-Queda members. Each day features a list of 3-4 errands to run, across all 5 days of the week (and 2 in the "Apocalypse Weekend" mode). The DLC, Paradise Lost, features almost the same layout: 5 days of errands, but no weekend. All in all, it's quite a different experience, yet not in a bad way at all, more of a substantial addition to the FPS family. Controls:WASD - MovementQ - KickE - Holster weaponR - Unzip pants (to pee) C - CrouchK - SuicideG - Yell somethingMouse - LookMousewheel - Switch weapons (scroll)1 - 0 - Choose different weapons if availableLeft click - Primary fireRight click - Secondary fireSpace - JumpZ - Drop weaponE/Enter - Use item or hand it overX - Drop itemM - Map[ or ] - Select item in inventoryGameplay:Each day you're able to do various tasks in order to complete the day. There's usually 3 tasks (some days have added tasks after one is completed, so 4). The days are outlined like a normal week; Monday - Friday, and the option to play a bonus mode called Apocalypse Weekend, which is Saturday and Sunday. Starting from your lovely home, Dude usually leaves with his wife ♥♥♥♥♥ing at him, as the game says, and given a task from her to do like pick up a book or cash a check. These tasks always turn hasty, ranging from psycho video game activists to terrorists attacking you and trying to kill you. Equipped with many weapons, the Dude has plenty to keep him protected, as well as sometimes a helper (like Champ, his dog) to assist you in your quests. Graphics:Graphics are not the games strong point, if only the only thing keeping anyone from buying this. Please, do not take this in the wrong way, the game is everything as interesting as if it was made in UE4. Realize it's a game from 2003, and this should help. Now, there's mods and everything to help things pop, I found one to make the mountains less flat and still doesn't decrease performance. There's also ENB's to reshade everything to your liking to not make it so bright, and also HD textures as well. I'm not saying the graphics are a super huge deal that this is a necessity, but some prefer to have the options to do so. I played the whole game and the DLC before I realised there were these things, and I still loved it. Game Balance:There's 10+ modes to choose from in difficulty, ranging from Easy to Impossible. Changing modes does not hinder your experience, each mode has the same content. Most people just play on Liebermode (easiest of all) just to play through the end. I have played all modes, including Postal. Jesus Christ it was a trip. OtherI need more DLC for this game, or a working Share the Pain for Windows10, please RWS. Final Rating:9.5/10In Conclusion:This game is an excellent example of how an FPS should feel, and with its customizability and humor, I literally did not go wrong buying this game. It was super fun playing through it, and every day was a blast. I wish there was more to it or at least a few more DLC's but that honestly is less priority than the real game. Concider picking it up if you have the money, it's often on sale on Steam for $1. Please feel free to follow my curation page for more recommendations. Thanks for reading!

												I have been meaning to do a review of this game for awhile, and here i am doing one.Okay i am going to be totally honest.I LOVE this F-ing game!I love the humor, i love the story, i love the crazy batsh*t insane sh* that goes down.. all of it.BUT... i do sadly find myself wanting to use cheats every time i play it... i'm not very good at FPS games sadly.So even though i have to cheat my♥♥♥♥♥off to enjoy this game, it's still worth the price.Once upon a time, i seen this game talked about on G4 as well as Tech TV back in the day.. and i remember seeing the player♥♥♥♥♥♥on someone.... it was at that moment i thought to myself.. i MUST play this game.Sadly i had NO damn clue where to get it... could not find it sold anywhere physically.So some years later go by, and i am unaware of steam mind you... i sit back and start looking up the game thinking "where can i get that game?!" Sadly the first time i owned it was maybe 3 years ago.. i found an illegal copy and i DLed it and went to town... you gotta remember, i had NO clue where to get it.. and i WOULD have paid for it...but could not find it and had no clue who made the game.Fast forward to earlier this year.. and BAM i have steam and it turns out the game IS on steam.. eventually i get the money and i buy it cause.. well.. i rather support the developers, i'm not a thief..I have been playing it since, and wow what a ride.. the steam version is way better and way more stable than that illegal copy, plus i can play the weekend story.This game is really ♥♥♥♥ing funny, especially in what you can do... the moment i♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥in someone's mouth and they threw up and ran of screaming.. i laughed so d*mn hard and thought "wow.. perfect game, right here!".The dude reminds me of me and my life.. me just trying to live day to day.. and everyone around me crazy in their heads!All i can say is after playing through and fighting the madcow deamon... i sat back going.."okay i need more of this, there has got to be more!" and sadly Postal 3 i have heard some bad things about so have yet to buy it..Can not WAIT for the new DLC being worked on, and i will be so happy when it releases because it will be a day one buy for me!By the way, i wish to say i am sorry to the developers RWS for basically stealing the game at first... i hope me buying it on steam makes up for it.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												Postal 2 has you play as "The Postal Dude", going through a week of various tasks to complete as you roam around the world doing whatever you please. Whether it's you getting some milk at a convience store, getting Gary Coleman's autograph or stealing a X-Mas tree, the variety is surely there. Along your journey, you have a decent arsenal of weapons such as a tazer and gasoline to light people ablaze. The game is fun and strangely addictive. You never feel like the tasks are being forced apon you and you can also do them in any order you like; some errands you can do in multiple ways which gives you some freedom that is needed. Postal 2 is also very humorous and over-the-top, while it sometimes steps over the boundaries, it's a game where you must take lightly. Apart from the "career" mode, there is also multiplayer and DLC. The multiplayer has not been working for me, nor is anyone playing it. The Apocolypse Weekend DLC is less of my taste. Going a linear road and more action oriented was a change of pace, it was still hilarious but it didn't enhance the game in any way. Postal 2 often has great moments and hilarity usually insues. While the game isn't polished, the gameplay is certainly there to give players one hell of a time. PROS:+Fun and Addicting+Hilarious+Great Moments+Variety+Cheap Price+Available Freedom+Weapons are satisfying to use+Modding Support(Future SteamWorkshop may be added)CONS: -Broken Multiplayer-DLC (Apocolypse Weekend) isn't that great-No "real" storyOverall, Postal 2 was a great buy. I got it for $2.50 while it was on sale, which was one of the best purchases I did in awhile.POSTAL 2 COMPLETE: 8.0/10

content:
Posted: November 15, 2014
												One of the most bizarre and controversial titles of the early 2000s is back and it’s found its way onto STEAM. Postal 2 Complete has been greenlit by the community, which either means that its now better than ever or that we’ve all completely lost our minds.After playing the game again, it would seem as though the latter is true.In Postal 2, you are given a number of errands that you must complete each day. While the errands are similar to what most of us would call “missions”, their objectives are often much more simple than the missions we’ve become accustomed to in RPGs and other titles. In a testament to this, one of the first errands you have to run is to go to the store and get some milk. The atmosphere of the store is hilarious, as the middle eastern music blasts and the shopkeeper insults all of the patrons in his shop. The brilliance of Postal 2 is the non-linear manner in which you can complete your errands. Do you just pay for the milk or do you just grab it and then fight your way out of the store, hitting everyone in your path with a shovel? The choice is yours. I should warn you though, the shop keeper is packing serious heat.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
												Let me start by saying Postal 2 will let you knock off someone's head, and urinate down the stump.Still interested? Good.Postal 2 is, at it's heart, a game for everyone, that anyone can relate to. You play as a guy who has errands to run throughout the week. How you get those errands done is up to you, but that's only part of the game - the other is, trying to get those errands done while surrounded by dim-witted, poorly dressed psychopaths.What will you do when you get your milk? Pay 5 bucks for a quart, or just walk out with it? Maybe set the place on fire? Maybe set EVERYTHING on fire? Smack people with a shovel to get to the front of the line? Pee in their eye? Drop a diseased cow head, causing everyone in its vicinity to hemorrhage blood from every orifice until they die, while the screaming survivors run out the door, only to be met by a carefully laid booby trap of grenades, blowing them apart in all directions? Maybe "borrow" a police uniform beforehand, so the cops don't chase you around while you do this?...not that I've ever done that.Postal 2 is definitely showing its age now, 11 years from its launch. However, unlike a lot of games, it has aged very, very well. The humor is tasteless, the violence is gratuitous, the various goings-on around Paradise are nothing short of pants-crappingly stupid. For all these reasons (and more), it is a brilliant gem of a game. If you have ever bumped into someone in public, been cut off in line, talked down to, or generally annoyed by anyone in your own life, you will find some representation of it in Postal 2.And you can hit it with a shovel.-----On a somewhat more serious note: I always thought it was brilliant what this game provided for players - an outlet to get out all of those "OMFG IMMA KEEL JOO" feelings we build up throughout our day, in a safe, harmless environment where no real people can possibly get hurt. For the time, a game like this was unheard of, and provided an outlet for rage that most people didn't have a healthy alternative for. If anything, RWS was years ahead of its time for this. That they proudly support their fans, even as their fans proudly support them, is just a sexy icing on the win-cake.TLDR: Just buy the stupid game, I've got stuff to do.

content:
Posted: August 14, 2015
												It breaks all the rules, it aims an enormous pi$$-take towards celebrities and groups/cultures, its secretly the game we all love to play. Paradise Lost takes place a decade after Apocalypse Weekend, the Postal Dude awakens from his 11-year radioactive-induced coma only to find his dog Champ is missing and has to go back to his home town of Paradise, which is now a post-apocalyptic wasteland. Paradise Lost also retcons Postal III as it was revealed that the events of that game were just a nightmare dream that the Postal Dude had during his coma. Thankyou devs, for understanding just how bad Postal 3 was!Expect familiar humour and circumstances in this wonderful, entertaining expansion. Its been a long time Postal, we've missed you.EDIT: Also as a sidenote, this game has the best set of achievements I've ever seen in a game. There are so many references inside them, definitely worth checking them out. For example, "Fear and Loathing" for smoking 10 health pipes and 10 tins of catnip in one play session, and "Finkle IS Einhorn!" Gave a kickoff to a severed head (Ace Ventura reference). Very well done.

number of helpful: 19 of 21 people (90%) found this review helpful8 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 23, 2016
"I regret nothing." ~Postal DudePostal 2 is a game about the life of the Postal Dude, a man who's just trying to get some errands done. Go get some milk, pick up your paycheck, return an overdue library book, etc. Unfortunately for the Dude, not everyone likes him, or what he does. You have to worry about doing things wrong in front of the police or armed citizens, not to mention the groups of people that hate you depending on each day, Taliban, and the military. The game proves, however, that you don't need a buff dude fighting aliens to be a badass, all you need is a scrawny ginger in an alien T-shirt and duster.The game itself is one of the most interesting early open-world shooters I've ever seen so far. Different areas of the map open up depending on the in-game day you're on, and there are many hidden areas to discover within Paradise. Exploration doesn't go unrewarded, however, since you can find many weapons, ammo, and other useful items by exploring your environment. Even places that would be inaccessible can be reached by simply walking across telephone wires.Gameplay in Postal 2 is a bit like GTA, minus the Auto. There are cars in the game, but they serve as explosive props rather than drivable objects. You have a wanted bar that lets you know just how much the police want to cuff you, as well as an inventory used to store your items. Aside from that, other things set it apart from most shooters of its style. You can silence a gun with a cat, throw a boomeranging machete, befriend a dog to kill enemies, and more. I like that the game breaks the fourth wall often as well, as Postal Dude makes remarks about the level design and uselessness of the cars. The game devs themselves, Running With Scissors, are a major part of the game's story.I rate Postal 2 a 9.5/10. This is one of the best early shooters I've played, and definitely one to pick up.

Some may call this game xenophobic, racist, violent, mindless and sexist, but I think it really speaks about our current society, and the way that we demonise those we are unfamiliar with. At the end of the day we are all human and must join together to defeat those capitalist pigs that plague our society. We must focus our efforts on reviving Supreme Leader Stalin from his cryogenic slumber and reclaim our corrupt planet in the name of Communists everywhere. Stay strong my brothers and sisters in arms, a war is coming.

content:
Posted: May 12, 2014
												You know those stupid overhyped news stories about how violent video games are negatively affecting today’s youth? This is exactly the kind of game that they’re afraid of. However, if you have any common sense (and a sense of humor) it’s pretty clear that Postal 2 is simply a satire of American paranoia and ignorance. You play as the Postal Dude, aiding him as he completes a list of tasks over the course of a week. As you go about your business, you’ll notice increasingly crazy things happening all around you, such as anti-violent video game protestors who seem to love trying to kill you, trigger-happy police officers, hillbillies who apparently love the movie “Deliverance”, and more. It’s all very ridiculous and over the top, but that’s exactly the point. Postal 2 is crude, extremely violent, outrageous, and lots of fun. Avoid if you’re easily offended. Otherwise, go postal.

content:
Posted: May 16, 2014
												There is a lot that can be said about Postal 2. It is obscene enough to be banned in Germany, New Zealand, Australia and a few other countries when it first released one decade ago. As a result, eviewer scores, fueled by moral panic, really dealt a blow to its overall score the first time around. Which is why it is a very good thing that this game got a new re-release on Steam 10 years later, because this game is a real hidden gem that deserves a lot more credit than it got.This game, in its original form, is a sandbox shooter with a lot of offensive and crude humor. It is set in the ironically-named fictional town of Paradise, populated by jerks. Players take on the role of some down-on-his-luck everyman, living on a trailer and about to be laid off. His task is to survive the week by taking on various errands. This seems mundane and uninteresting on the surface, however, littered around the town are tools that let the player cause mayhem and destruction, as well as extremeist and special interest groups that are hell bent on killing the player dead. Not only that, but at various points, events happen that put the player in situations that they must come out of alive.Then, we have the Steam edition of the game, which adds a ton of new extra content, as well as canonizing one of the more popular mods for the game as part of the package. This mod introduces even more enemy types for you to blow up, as well a couple new toys to play with. This mod also offers a more linear mission structure, which provides an interesting contrast to the type of gameplay present in the original game.On top of that, there is a third campaign which combines both the original game and the content of the mod into seven whole days of mayhem. There is even a hidden unlock that players can get if they beat this third combined campaign in the very hard POSTAL difficulty mode.What makes these single player experiences so compelling is the inclusion of choice for the player. They have the ability to choose whether they want to survive the errands peacefully, or if they would like to do so causing as much mayhem as possible. They have a vast potential arsenal of weapons and toys that they can pick up and cause mayhem with. Not only that, a lot of the crude and offensive humor is put there as a biting commentary of the then (and possibly now) fast-food culture and excesses of contemporary western culture. Gameplay-wise, I also like how the wanted system is set up so that your wanted meter only goes up when committing a crime in the proximity of law enforcement.This game also includes a multiplayer portion (Share the Pain) for deathmatch mayhem, and all things considered, it would have been a really fun experience, if the netcode was better. Which is a shame, because that means that having a lag-free experience entails getting all your friends together for a LAN party, which isn't exactly viable if all your friends are spread across the world. There is also the minor issue of game stability and intermittent crashes, however this shouldn't be too much of a problem with the smart use of saves.In short, I would highly recommend that you pick up this game, there is no question about it, as its normal selling price is $9.99 which is a steal for a game with this amount of potential enjoyment. And if this isn't a good enough deal for you, this game now has workshop support, which gives you the option of downloading and playing through a plethora of well-made user content.

number of helpful: 17 of 20 people (85%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 14, 2014
												(Update, my review got on the RWS site! http://runningwithscissors.com/main/index.php?topic=2024 Just scroll down!)Well this game is basically the most fun I have had in games for years, and let me tell you why in pros and consPROS:The Postal Dude!: You are the Postal Dude, and what do you do? Go postal! The whole point of the game is to cause mayhem and have fun with it, plus he makes alot of funny quips and they are even fun to hear over and over again.The Town: You live in Paradise Arizona, how ironic the name is since the place is full of idiots, gun toting idiots, or bomb toting idiots, but that's the best part about it.Characters: The characters you meet are just so funny and rude that it's hard to find anything bad about them, they are all hilarious.Guns: The guns in this game are so much fun to use, even though you have absolutely no reload, I don't see how a m16 can carry 400 bullets in the clip but I ain't complainin.Peeing on people: Yes, you can do this, you can urinate on somebody till they vomit or just to be a a$$ to them.Dogs and cats: You can use the dogs are friends! They fight with you! And as for the cats...well...you basically put the barrell of your gun up their a$$ and guess what you have? A Kitty Silencer!Gore: This game is very very gorey, blood, chopped limbs, guts everywhere, decapitation, it's fun!Exploring: There are guns and ammo lying all over the place, as well as melee weapons you can find rummaging around, and each day most of the weapons change and won't be there, but new weapons will be in other places.The Errands: Each day you have errands to do, get milk, go to bank, etc. but the fun part about this game is it doesn't feel like a boring old errand, you actually do something in it, for the bank when you go there you can wait in line or Pee on everyone to get out of the way so you can go first.Quotes and Easter Eggs: Easter Eggs are hidden throughout the game, as well as the achievements, the one I seemed to notice in a instant was the Bates Hotel with "Murder free showers"The civilians: The civilians are just all around hilarious, some are nice, but most are just complete a$$hats, so if you walk through the town and you notice 2 civis fighting each other with guns, you're first thought will be "What the heck is wrong with this place" But later on when you start seeing it more you think "Just another day in Paradise..."Breaking the 4th wall: This is the best part, or one of the best parts, the Postal Dude knows you are controlling him, and he makes quips over it too, if you quick save 2 times in a few seconds he'll sometimes say "Didn't you just save?" Or "My grandmother could beat the game saving as much as you do."Still being updated: Yes, you read that right, Running With Scissors (RWS) is STILL updating this game even though it's 10-11 years old, they are even making a workshop with it one day too, they extracted "A week in paradise" mod and put some of the guns and weapons in the main game itself, these guys must love their fans!Now for the Cons:CONS:Guns: Some guns are highly dangerous, even on lower level difficulty, Rockets can kill you almost instantly, even with armor and full healthGroups: Throughout the game there are groups that end up hating you for doing something to them, IE you go return a book to the library and these Tree Protestors burn the place down while you are in it and you have to kill them to get out and they hate you for the rest of the game, but it's fun as well, it keeps it's pace and when you run into them you can easily run away...or kill them.Saving: Do this alot in the game, cause if you started a level and it auto saves, and you did everything in that area, and died without saving, you have to go through it all over again, so be a Spasstic saver, don't be afraid.Unskippable cutscenes: It gets annoying if you die after watching a cutscene and you didn't save, and you have to do the whole thing over again, seriously? It's not hard to make a skip cutscene button you know.Overall this game is fun as hell, and if you start saving all over the place you can get through those cons with ease, this game deserves a 9-10/10, and it is well worth it, can't wait till they get the Workshop running.

content:
Posted: April 14
This is a long review, so if you want a brief summary of why I recommend Postal 2 skip to Results and read from there.Running with Scissors creates a game so brutal and offensive it was banned in many countries upon its original release. Postal 2 offers more than just comedy by providing a fun and intense first person shooter in an non-repetitive environment. Story:The game starts with The Dude, clearly a play off the Big Lebowski who has moved to a small town to take up the career of being a video game star. But life isn’t so easy for The Dude, who must also live his day-to-day life. When playing Postal 2 your missions are to complete the tasks The Dude’s wife gives him, how you do this is up to you. You play The Dude’s life for up to an entire week, and somehow things just get drastically more ridiculous as you move forward. Campaign:Depending on your sense of humor you may love this game, or absolutely hate it. Interestingly Postal 2 is able to achieve dynamic levels of comedy with blatant racism, sexual innuendos, extreme violence, tv/movie references, and much more. Remember this game was made back in 2003, so if you can’t get past older games graphics then this may not be for you. The campaign is as long/short as you make it, if you gun through it you can do it in an hour and a half, if you take your sweet time like myself it’ll probably last 8-10 hours. The game also comes with a variety of different difficulties, I don’t know all their names but there are about 15 or so difficulty levels. Hopefully this should allow everyone to be able to enjoy this game, from the casual relaxed to the extreme. Gameplay:The game is focused around completing errands off a to-do-list that ends up leading to a crazy adventure of terrorists, strip clubs, religious radicals, military, local law enforcement, and even the demons of hell. The game plays like a standard FPS from the early 2000’s. Kind of more a Half/Life style combat as if it could have been made using Gary’s Mod. The map is open world, with directional quests. Sometimes quests will pull you into an area which is more of a guided level, but when you come out the campaign goes back to open world. Overall with the DLC offers a relatively decent length campaign on typical FPS standards. With the incredibly unique weapon choices, from putting a cat on your rifle as a silencer to lighting your foes with gasoline “Postal 2” offers an array of fun and creative ways to go Postal. Hints:>In the police station all the way on the top floor in the locker room is an officer uniform. IF you grab this uniform you can go nuts killing people and the cops won’t care. This uniform will last one day, its well worth if you want to make one day incredibly easy.>You will get multiple weapons that occupy single slots – for example: you will have a sign post, sledge hammer, hatchet, police baton, scythe all occupy number 1. To switch them just keep pressing 1 on your keyboard. This applies to weapons in other slots as well. This may seem obvious, but I didn’t realize I had multiple weapons until the Thursday.  Results:I’d definitely recommend this game, even at full price; although, if you’re hesitant it goes on sale frequently. The campaign is a good length, and even when you’re done you may want to just go back and try playing the game with a different flare. It has a decent difficulty curve, and the optional gameplay style provides a dynamic experience. Not I’d avoid this game if you’re not able to take a joke or are overly sensitive regarding politics and religion. Pros:+Open world map (for 2003 that’s quite impressive).+Funny campaign with amusing story.+Loads of weapons to choose from.+Secrets, got to love those old game secrets.Cons:-Have to keep running with his annoying wife’s errands. I mean really, does she need Milk or Gary Colemans autograph?

content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												There was a time in gaming history when 'worried' politicians and parents were sure that games cause violence. Many of the classics were stomped by suit'n'tie men and women: Quake, Doom, GTA... but one game was known for being the most violent, depraved, senseless depiction of lunacy - POSTAL.First one was isometric shooter and it introduced us to the concept of senseless violence. We've needed to kill everyone and everything to pass the level. Killing was mandatory, and those enemies were no aliens or demonic creatures - they were all (mostly) innocent humans.POSTAL 2 arrived sometimes around 2002 or 2003, can't really tell, and it brought the violence into a 3D world. The game went FPS and Postal Dude fans went nuts about it.Considering that today we have more violent games people play and no one gets mad and there are basically no more politicians, senates, governments and parents deeply worried about what their children play, Postal 2 still stands out as a prime example of total, senseless violence. This game is still 0% politically correct, madness-driven insult toward everyone and everything. It plays nicely on cliches, prejudices and morals - it doesn't give a flying ♥♥♥♥ about religions, races, social, economic or sexual orientations - it's against everyone and everything.But is it a good shooter? No, it is not. It is full of glitches, bugs and the reason why it stills stands the test of time is the amount of insults its dispersing every time you launch it. If you're a grouchy intellectual, you might find the whole thing tiring and repetitive, but putting people on fire,♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥on their corpses or in their mouths until the point they vomit, using cats as silencers, chopping off heads with a shovel is still pretty fun, if you're open-minded, clever person knowing it's all bad humor. Yes, in case you ask about my own opinion: violent games can make you go violent only if you're unstable person.Should you get it?a) NO, if you're a sensitive person.b) NO, if you're looking for a decent FPS and you're more interested in game mechanics than idiotic moments of Postal 2.c) YES, if you're ready to grin, smirk and laugh your♥♥♥♥♥off at complete lunacy and can get past pretty glitchy shooter.d) YES, if you've played it back then - getting it for 2 € is like a blast-from-the-past ticket. And game has been improved since then - more voices, more weapons, more characters and Steam achievements, so it's pretty busty. (har-har)***If you like this review, feel free to join me for some more recommendations at http://steamcommunity.com/groups/libereviews

content:
Posted: January 4, 2015
												Surprisingly fun for a 10 year old title. Didn't expect much from it getting it for $0.99 but this is a great game that still holds up. You're let loose upon the politically incorrect, offensive, and amusing world of POSTAL. Given objectives to complete each day (level), you can go about the game as a normal person, but who the hell wants to do that. Lines taking too long? People getting♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥because you walk by them? Pull out your shotgun and blow their heads off. Combat is SO SATISFYING. It's great for blowing off some steam decapitating people with hedge clippers, dousing them in gasoline and lighting them on fire, and urinating on someone until they vomit. Some may call it immature or that you have issues, but this is a hell of a game. Satisfying, BRUTAL, combat.It also has some of the best achievements out there. They're aren't too grindy and are actually very fun to get. Lure a cop with a♥♥♥♥♥♥soaked doughnut, play fetch with your dog using a severed head, kill members of the Taliban in a suicide blast, etc.Due to the open nature of the levels it's pretty replayable and you can lose yourself for hours screwing around.Worth base price. Definitely worth sale price.C U Next Tuesday!

content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
												The most artistic indie game I've ever played. In Postal 2, you must resist the urge to be a terrible person in a world that mirror's our own. Guns are everywhere in Arizona, and everyone carries them because of the damned Republicans and their concealed carry laws. The game shows you what can go wrong in such a society, as things get progressively worse every day. It's also a pretty good simulation of life. You can pee in the toilets, (can't flush them though, no use key). You can collect stray cats and deposit them in safe places, You can also find tanks of gasoline and fuel up people's cars. Neat! You can do almost anything your imagination can think of!

content:
Posted: July 4, 2016
												Postal 2 is an extreme, unrestrained, and deliberately shocking fps action game with open world elements. Postal 2 is a game that panders to nobody, makes no effort to disguise its crude, satirical humor, and makes every effort to be as violent, repulsive, and entertaining as you want to make it. If I had to describe Postal 2 in two words, they'd be "consciously repugnant". That might sound fantastic, and it might sound terrible; it all depends on who you are, of course. Now, before you form your opinion, allow me to describe this in a little more detail:This day in age, Postal 2 is not an outstandingly controversial and/or offensive game, so there's little discussion to be had there. For the squeemish and easily offended, however, this certainly isn't the game for you. Postal 2 is a notably violent and innovatively disgusting game, so much so that it gives the game a certain, revolting charm. If you find that you are not easily offended, nor easily deterred by obscenity, violence, or the somehow comical use of urination, then you should strongly consider playing this game. It is a very unique experience, and if you ask me, an equally enjoyable one. This game earned it's infamy, and it did not disappoint me.Overall Rating=6.8/10 Good, unclean fun

content:
Posted: June 4, 2016
												Postal 2 is an openworld-esque game in roughly the same sense that Deus Ex is: Fairly large maps with a loading screen every now and then. It's an errand objective based game spanning across 7 days in where you do a different set of errands in (mostly) any order each day. Errands, which go incredibly wrong most of the time, and involve very much violence.The game has an inventory system of sorts with pretty much no limit except for ammocounts, items include things such as: Healing items ranging from a simple doughnut, to an overpowered health capping drug, as well as catnip which can be used as a bullet time drug, and cats which can literally be used as shotgun silencers. There's also healthkits you can pickup and use immediately, but not carry around in your inventory. The Postal Dude would rather carry an armada of cats and enough fastfood to kill America, but not something sensible like healthkits. Absolutely no complaints here.This has something in common with Shadow Warrior and the Jedi Knight Star Wars games, in that they both have firearms and a really awesome melee weapon(s) you use all the time because it's more effective and more fun, and tons more of decapitations.There's tons of melee weapons, guns, and things to set on fire. If you catch on fire, you can♥♥♥♥♥♥in the air to put yourself out. You can also pour gasoline everywhere in funny shapes and set it on fire to display something stupid, and then set everyone on fire. And then♥♥♥♥♥♥it all out.At one point I got some soldiers I rescued from a secret terrorist base to sign a petition to make whiny old congressmen play violent video games. I couldn't be any happier when this happened.The game's feel and engine is somewhere between Half-Life and Deus Ex and something else. Old crunchy feel to the levels (but not quite that old), and the silly movement bob when you move. Except Postal Dude can take seemingly even more damage than Gordon Freeman himself. All those years of drug abuse must have weaved some sort of kevlar equivalent into his skin or something.Also, at one point, the developers amazingly decided to release an expansion for this game 10+ years after it came out, kind of like how Age of Empires II got new DLC itself. Still can't believe either of those happened.Game kind of runs like trash at times, especially when too many NPCs are thinking, like fighting things and just generally freaking out. I've had 2 crashes in the main game in my roughly 12 hours of playing, so the game is stable enough.So yeah, it's a violent classic. Go buy it and cause chaos, or be a pacifist and just do errands, or something.

number of helpful: 12 of 13 people (92%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												This game has been reviewed plenty to give a good idea of what it's like, although I feel like POSTAL 2 does not sell itself as well as it could - mainly since the main joke of their trailers is how bad the game is. It makes it seem not just like a game where the devs didn't take it seriously, but one where they didn't try and this is not the case. I've recommended this game to friends before and they worry that the game will be boring - since there is no plot and the tasks seem bleak. This is just the gimmick though, and I must stress that the actual gameplay goes on way deeper than many other games do. I feel like RWS just don't give themselves enough credit for what they have created.I hope my 150 (current) hours of gameplay is enough to prove this. I've explored basically everything the game has to offer, yet the built-in workshop allows other users to keep providing more content to the game, and is still active, much like the community, despite the game's age. The game's soundtrack also introduce me to my favourite band - Jesus Loves Junkies - which I will always be thankful for.I would definitely recommend buying it, at least to try it out. If you're not so certain, wait for a sale since the game is usually very cheap then, and I believe that 2 hours of gameplay should be enough time to help you decide, and will do a much better job than watching gameplay can, as a weapon always feels better when it's in your hands.

content:
Posted: March 7, 2016
POSTAL 2 Review - Rating: 8.7/10General ImpressionPOSTAL 2 is an adventurous game, mostly fitting to people who enjoy violent games. The graphics for 2003 are spectacular, the soundtrack are enjoyable, the atmosphere varies from outside to buildings and houses in the city called Paradise, AZ (in the USA). The gameplay is an open-world type, having the ability to do whatever you want, such as walking through the town, killing civilians/gangsters/police, beating animals, urinating on anything you want, a pretty rebel gameplay. The story is about The Postal Dude which just moved to Paradise, AZ with his wife, and his dog, Champ. He will have to go through 7 days (from Monday to Sunday) where he will have to accomplish many risky takes, which mostly have unwanted consequences. The engines are well optimized, very rare crashes, and generally good engines.GraphicsThe graphics are spectacular for the year 2003, being a huge improvement over the first POSTAL game, by bringing the three dimensions feature and brining in the First-Person and the Third-Person. This game can be run even on low performance computers, which would still be able to run this game on Medium-High. The sky is mostly blue-yellowish, nights are very rare in this game, the cars, the guns, the buildings, and the nature things are well designed. Humans are being randomly deployed, being pretty well designed too. The buildings and houses are also well designed, giving more reality to Paradise.AtmosphereThe atmosphere varies from being outside to the ability to walk in every single building or house of this game, being a huge advantage for explorers. We may also see desert, because it’s located in Arizona. In the south of the town we may see higher altitudes, which also contain some forests. The game mostly happens during the daytime, very rare during the night time. We may see people everywhere, even animals, cats can be attached on shotguns, which seems pretty funny. There are many places to visit, also the DLC expands the areas even more (underground areas and even a new Paradise, a terrorized one. The population is very scared due to the atomic explosion which happened years back then.Audio/MusicThe soundtrack of this game were composed by RWS, proving that the developer has truly put effort in making a completely original game. During fights, we may hear some dynamic soundtracks, which encourages you to fight even better. While doing missions or just exploring the city, no soundtracks will play. We may hear birds singing, people talking, and sometimes the wind. We may also hear animals, such as dogs chasing cats, etc. The sound of the bullets are pretty alright, the voice acting is also very nice, especially for The Postal Dude.GameplayThe gameplay is about The Postal Dude who does many tasks for his wife, such as buying milk, returning an overdue library book, getting Gary Coleman’s autograph, etc. This game is Open-World too, you may walk everywhere, and you can do what you want, anytime. You can even buy pizzas, donuts, drinks, etc. Also, there are some vending machines which sell heal kits, drugs (for health), etc.  (the health vending machine) and guns, grenades, vests, etc. (the weapons vending machine).  You can also talk with people (only the ones which have connections with missions). Overall good gameplay.StoryThe story Is about The Postal Dude which just moved in Paradise, AZ with his wife and his dog, Champ. He has to go through many adventures, among tasks given by his wife.  He needs to buy milk, steak pay his debts, return overdue books, and pretty much everything about violence/killing. After Friday, his wife will shot him in the head, causing him a tumor. In the next 2 days, he will make his way out of Paradise. In the new DLC, The Postal Dude came back In Paradise, but most of the town was already terrorized by the past atomic bomb, detonated by The Postal Dude himself. He will have to deal with many nations, such as Arabs, the Coleman family, etc.  The difficulties are way too many, nobody would need to choose from that many.EnginesThe engines on this game are well optimized, almost no crashes or bugs. The people's movements are pretty good, starting from walking calm through the town to running due to being alerted. The sky does not move, but in the DLC we may find snowing. In the cities there are cars which stand on the edge of the road or in garages, however, none of them is ever moving. When you shoot down somebody to death, I feel like their falling is not realistic. They just simply fall, not like in reality.  Also, I did not like how the sand is behaving. Instead of flowing in the air, it simply stays on the ground. This game can be played even on low performance computers, which give it a huge advantage.Other FeaturesThe multiplayer is pretty nice, it has some awesome maps and modes. However, it’s not alive anymore, making it pretty useless. If you have some friends who play it as well, play with them, you won’t regret your decision. The user interface is well-designed, being detailed with some blood additions, making it perfect for this type of violent games. The controls are well-chosen, which are a little complex, but you will have an easy time learning them. Some of the controls are displayed in the top-left screen. The mechanics are pretty nice, even though you get stuck in random objects sometimes, they are still pretty well-optimized. Everything around the city moves well. Overall, it’s a really enjoyable violent and dark-humor game.Positive PointsWell-designed graphics for 2003Almost no bugs or crashesNice audio and musicAwesome voice actingPretty Well-optimizedGood and coordinated AIA big city to exploreA great sense of dark humorMany weapons to choose fromAn open-world gameLong storylineMuch Steam Workshop contentGood and long DLCNeutral Points Too many difficulties to choose fromThe multiplayer is not alive anymoreBeing able to drive cars would be greatNegative PointsFrequent loading zonesYou get stuck in random objects sometimesThe multiplayer is not so alive anymore

content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
POSTAL 2REVIEWPostal 2. What do i say about a game, launched more than 10 years ago, that created a lot of controversy, was banned in more than 13 countries, where you can pee on people, kill dogs and cats, and decapitate, explode or cut in pieces everything you see, using dozens and dozens of weapons, including shovels, tazers, RPGs and everything you can think of. In this game you control the Postal Dude, and you live as him in one "normal" week of his life. You have to do some work, like getting milk and easy things, getting Gary Coleman autograph. What could go wrong? The game is very funny, have a great gameplay and even a good time of campaign. It includes too the Apocalypse Weekend DLC, so, zombies and more playtime. The game graphics are outdated of course but are ok. The game contains a lot of bugs, they are funny but some are game breaking at some times, and the Apocalypse Weekend is very boring. Voice-acting is a funny thing: Postal Dude have an amazing one but the other characters suck. The game also have a soundtrack that have some cool musics sometimes but the game almost have no music. Postal 2 is very funny overall, and there is a cool multiplayer, but few people play it.+Funny comments of Postal Dude+Amazing voice-acting for Postal Dude+Funny and easy gameplay+Good length campaign+You can pee on people and use cats and dogs for a lot of things+Apocalypse Weekend DLC for free+A lot of guns+Open World+Unique Multiplayer+Still updated by Developer+Many items-Poor Soundtrack-Voice-acting for NPC's suck-Many loadings -Boring Apocalypse Weekend DLC-Poor animations and cutscenes-Big amount of bugsBesides it's flaws, Postal 2 is one of the funniest and controversial games ever made 8/10 BUT, I have to say: I do not recommend this game for EVERYONE. The game is very, very offensive for...everything. So, if you hate someone offending something you like, or hate nonsense violence, etc. Do not play this game.

												Postal 2 in a sense is kinda like the grandpa of GTA but hella more offensive in terms of it's portrayal of blood, gore, stereotypes and so on. When it was first released to the public back in the early 2000s, it received major criticism for gore and violence as well as getting a zero rating with several game critics.However, Postal 2 is one of those games that was able to shine later on when people were able to appreciate the message the developers wanted to portray. "The game is only as violent as you are..." and RWS is right, you DONT have to go through the entire game killing everyone in sight (you can anyways). This level of freedom gives the player a variety of challenges from going POSTAL (manslaughter) on everyone to going about objectives peacefully on Hestonworld difficulty. The game offers a variety of challenges for many types of gamers and it wouldn't hurt to buy this game and play it yourself. Also the game offers mod support so if you're into making mods, contributing to the growing modding community would help a lot!

content:
Posted: May 20, 2014
In Postal 2, the player takes on the role of the Postal Dude, a tall and thin red-headed man with a goatee, sunglasses, a black leather trench coat, and a t-shirt with a grey alien's face printed on it. Postal Dude lives in a trailer park in the small town of Paradise, Arizona, with his nagging wife, who is identified in the credits as simply, the 'Postal Dude's ♥♥♥♥♥'. The game's levels are split into days of the week starting Monday and finishing Friday.At the beginning of each day, Postal Dude is given several tasks to accomplish, such as 'get milk', 'confess sins', and other seemingly mundane tasks. The object of Postal 2 is to finish all of the tasks throughout the week, and the player can accomplish these tasks in any way he or she wishes, be it as peaceful and civilly as possible, or as violent and chaotically as possible. It is possible, if occasionally difficult, to complete most tasks without engaging in battle, or at least, harming or killing other characters, as evidenced by the game's tagline: "Remember, it's only as violent as you are!". The daily tasks can be accomplished in any order the player desires, and the game also includes one task that is activated only when Postal Dude urinates, in which the player is tasked with getting treatment for gonorrhea after Postal Dude discovers he has the infection.Throughout the course of the game, Postal Dude must put up with being provoked by other characters on a regular basis. He is given the finger, mugged, attacked by various groups of protesters, and is harassed by an obnoxious convenience store owner/terrorist and his patrons who cut before Postal Dude in the "money line". During the game, Postal Dude also encounters a marching band, a murderous toy mascot named Krotchy, the Paradise Police Department and its SWAT team, overzealous BATFE agents, the Arizona Army National Guard, an eccentric religious cult, cannibalistic butcher shop workers, fanatical Al-Qaeda terrorists, and former child actor Gary Coleman, among many others.By Friday afternoon, the final day in the game, the apocalypse occurs and societal collapse soon follows, with all law and order breaking down. Cats begin to fall out of a darkly-colored sky, and almost everyone in town becomes heavily armed, with random gun battles breaking out in the streets. Despite this, Postal Dude returns home to his trailer as normal, where he then gets into an argument with his wife, who demands that Postal Dude explain why he never picked up the ice cream she asked for at the beginning of the game. Postal 2 then ends with a gunshot being heard, before being kicked to the end credits.

content:
Posted: July 20, 2016
												A fun half open-world half linear action game with sandbox elements, but not for the fainthearted- for example: you can use a cat as a scilencer for your shotgun or pee in peoples' faces until they vomit, not to mention achievements that your friends can see and then ask themselves 'should I remove this person?' I like this game as you can see from my rating- not because of the excessive violence, but just because it's a fun game, but has some boring parts (loading, walking everywhere, etc.). Also the devs are still supporting this 13 year old game (a new easter egg was made in 2016) and the community is still pretty active. Another good thing about this game is that it can run pretty smooth on most computers. I don't want to get into the "story" because it's quite the experience... The actual gameplay is walking around doing chores and errands and things that can be normal (buying milk) or crazy (blowing up cows with grenades). In conclusion, I personally think it's a fun game, but you should consider watching a gameplay video or two and see if it's your cup of tea.

Posted: August 22, 2016
												Really good game, tops so many AAA games nowadays.This game usually goes on sale for a dollar which is well worth it, you can pile up hours of gaming into this game, there are plenty to do. While it may seem like a linear story, the tasks can be completed at players pace, and the free roam is amazingly fun.Let's get into the pros and cons...Pros:- offensive, pushing the boundaries of comedy perfectly (racial stereotypes, peeing people and watching them throw up)- Unique story- numerous different weapons- players can enter 90% of the buildings in the map- decent sized modding community (adds more hours of fun)- several difficulties maybe around 10 - easy to run- repayable Cons: - outdated graphics- May crash randomly- May get repetitive sooner or later - outdated shootingOverall I would easily recommend getting this game, old but gold.

												Despite the game being very dated... and so far has aged very well compared to modern shooters that are... well... copy paste mechanics and gameplay in every single release, this one however is a bit more unique.I don't know why, but I can't stop the urge to seldomly just kill or shoot someone... just right out of nowhere, boom boom death everywhere. Not sure if that's me releasing my frustration on the world or the side of me that wants the whole world to burn and bathe in their blood like the psychopath I may be. It's up to debate honestly...Anyway, game's good, can be a massive time waster without even realizing it. It's like watching a train-wreck with explosives and deaths and fires and... more explosives. It's impossible to look away once it starts. You'll be glued to it forever. The weekends are the longest ones, however, than Mon-Fri. I thought Sunday would never end.I've had a few issues of crashing here and there... not sure what exactly is causing them, but was purely random and at least rare. Too much going on at once?It's worth the price. Wouldn't wait for a sale. content:
Posted: January 20
												Running With Scissors released this controversial mess of a game a long time ago, and it continues to be a fun way to relieve stress. The game has a style of humor that is fun for the most part, though a bit dated at times, and gives you tons of ways to kill your foes because, let's be honest, killing people is the definitive way to beat this game, though you can be a pacifist if you want to. Along with the base game, which lasts for 5 days, you have the Apocalypse Weekend expansion free of charge, which adds 2 more days. You can merge these to blend their weapons and stories together in a separate mode. Along with this LONG campaign, there's workshop support, achievements and trading cards. This is a remarkably full featured game. Now, we have all that, but what if I told you the main character talks Duke Nukem style and has the coolest voice I've heard in a game since... Duke Nukem.Postal 2 is a mostly funny, expansive and enjoyable game with a bunch of supportive and friendly developers as well. I'd say get it. Its cheap, so there's not much to lose.

												Possibly the greatest game to ever exist in all of time. The 100+ hours that I've spent have all been pure enjoyment (till I completed the Week on POSTAL difficulty, I hated my life at that point.)There isn't really anything about this game that I hate. I love just about everything about this game! Keep in mind this game is NEVER to be taken serious. This is a Dark Humor game, and it shows. It pushes the limits like no other game dares to try. Hell most of the achievements have some sort of♥♥♥♥♥♥♥in the images, or swears. Now coming after Postal 1, which was "Kill everything," this game gives you untold amount of options. You can complete the entire game without killing anyone!The fact they even made a true Expansion for this game 11 YEARS LATER says a lot. The brilliant minds at Running With Scissors are amazing people and LOVE their fans, and they prove that with the Paradise Lost Expansion. Yes I'm calling it an Expansion and not DLC, that is how much content is in it!Everyone can have their Call of Dudes, Battlefields, Arsarsin's Creeds (Steam censorship), and what ever cash cow big AAA companies produce *cough*  EA, Ubisoft, ♥♥♥♥ Konami  *cough*, or what ever cheap low live scam artist Indi Devs *cough* ImminentUprising *cough*, but I will stick with games that are♥♥♥♥♥♥♥FUN! content:
Posted: December 2, 2016
												I'm going to be honest. The first time I played Postal 2, it was two years ago and I hacked it. Just the three first days, nothing else. I loved it. I stopped playing because I felt like this wasn't right. This game is amazing. I want to give those guys my money. I didn't even have a bank account back then, I couldn't buy anything. And with time, I forgot that game. Until recently, when I saw it on Steam and I was like "♥♥♥♥♥♥ wait... Wait wait wait wait wait, THAT GAME ! I REMEMBER IT !" and bought it. With his DLC Paradise Lost. Because those guys deserve money. This game is often said to be "one of the worst" but honestly, no. Just no. This game is really good. Here's why.THE GOOD STUFF1) The gameplay. The game is an FPS with a♥♥♥♥♥♥load of differents weapons, from standard pistol to Rocket launcher, gasoline, napalm launcher and lots more. You can even♥♥♥♥♥♥on peoples. Litteraly. The gameplay is pretty fun and responsive, it never gets boring. Good stuff here.2) The graphics. This game came out in 2003 and for the time, it was okay. Not amazing, but it was nice. It has it's own charm. The DLC Paradise Lost ads lots of visual effects too, such as snow, water, rain and light effects. Good stuff.3) The humour. By god is that game funny. Yeeeeeah it's offensive, but that's the point : the game has no limit. You wanna kill Ben Laden before decapitating him and♥♥♥♥♥♥on his neck ? Go on. Wanna burn Gary Coleman before♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥on his burning corpse ? Go on. The situations the game puts you in and the freedom the player has are freaking hilarious. Yeah, it's offensive, but it's hilarious.THE BAD STUFF1) The lack of music. Even though Paradise Lost added some musics, the normal game is pretty silent. And it can get REALLY BORING. some music in the gunfights would've been nice.2) The loadings. They are horrible. yeas it's necessary, but they are everywhere, it breaks the flow of the game and you end up not wanting to explore the town because there's two loading screens up ahead. That sucks.Appart from that, this game is great. It's funny, violent, you are completely free, it has the best DLC EVER MADE... Don't listen to the peoples calling it the "worst" because it's offensive and give it a try.That was my review. And before you start bashing my like "THIS GAME IS♥♥♥♥♥♥HOW DARE YOU SAY IT'S GOOD", just know this. I wrote it. I think everything I said. And I regret nothing.
