number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
												Do you like FPS games? Do you like FPS games in a sandbox world? Do you like games that push things to the edge in a world of political correctness? Well, POSTAL 2 might just be the game for you.Story:The story of the game is simple. It's all about the protagonist fittingly named Postal Dude and his daily errands. The game is separated into five levels, but if you include the Apocalypse Weekend expansion, there's seven. One level for each day of the week. Each day has it's own list of errands that Dude must complete in order to progress to the next day. As you follow Postal Dude on his journey and complete errands, something always goes wrong such as being attacked by video game protesters, rednecks and various other social groups that become Dude's enemies throughout the game.Gameplay:The game gives you a large arsenal of weapons to combat these enemies. Sure, you can use your standard weapons like shotguns or machine guns, but why stop there when you can get a cat and attach it's rear end to the muzzle? There's a great selection of melee weapons as well. There's sledgehammers, boomerang machetes, shears, scythes and more. So if decapitating your enemies with a shotgun blow to the head just isn't doing it for you, you can run around with your shears and manually dismember your enemies limb by limb. There's also gasoline and matches that you can use to set people on fire. Did I mention that you can♥♥♥♥♥♥on people? Well you can. You can even♥♥♥♥♥♥on yourself. So if you ever find yourself on fire, just unzip, look up and let it rain. You can play the game the way YOU want to play it. If you want to run around shooting everything in sight, you can. However, if you want to play without so much as attacking a single person, you can do that as well. It may be more challenging that way, but it's possible.Conclusion:Overall, this is an amazing game. Don't come looking for a deep, thought-provoking story. This game doesn't have it. But what it does have is incredibly addictive gameplay with practically endless possibilities and a plot that's simple enough to keep your interest along the way. This is one of those games where once you beat it, you likely won't stop playing it for a while. It's a fun sandbox to run around in aimlessly while you watch your favorite TV show or listen to your favorite podcast. If you're offended easily, this game may not be for you. Otherwise, I'd highly recommend it. This may very well be my favorite FPS game of all-time and if it isn't, it's definitely up there.

content:
Posted: May 29, 2014
												With the amount of controversy that surounded this game I was curious as to whether or not it was actually any good.  After playing I can say that it is a hilariously fun game that anyone with a sense of humor can enjoy.  I also find it ironic that, for a game poking fun at how the media portrays violent games as the root of all evil, it became a main example for people that do not approve of violent games to use in court as evidence to support their beliefs.  The irony here is that the entire game can be beaten without harming anyone, proving that games are only as violent as the people that play them.  Didn't mean for this to turn into a speech.  Bottomline really funny game, go play it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 17, 2014
												Crude... Offensive... Tactless... All words that come to mind when describing Postal 2. All good words, mind, and they certainly add to the charm of this rather unconventional first-person shooter. "Live a life in the week of the Postal Dude!" they shout. And you certainly will, with all the shenanigans that occur in this game. Ferom killing protestors on Monday to visiting your crazy Uncle's compound on Thursday to surviving the apocalypse on the Weekend, the game is jam-packed with things to do. You COULD cash your check and be on your way... or you could break into the bank's vault and steal everything. You COULD wait in line to pay for the milk... but you won't. You COULD ethically let cats go.... or you could use them as silencers. The game is only as offensive and sick as you are, and thats part of the beauty of it. If you want to be Mr. Nice Guy and not kill a soul, you CAN, but you shouldn't. If you want to be Happy McMurderson, you CAN, and you probably should be. What with the new big update that the devs put up here, you have even more tools to start cracking skuls with. Why delay the inevitable by putting buying this off? Just buy it now, give it a go, and laugh(or cry) at the sheer amount of dumb fun that this game offers.9/10 would probably bang again

												TL;DR: Genius in its simplicity in most aspects. will satisfy bloodlust if you have it or justify the violence diegetically if you don't. Don't try this at home. Runs on any computer that can run Steam.Want to butcher and urinate on people? This game's for you.Want a diegesis that justifies said butchering and urinating? This game's  ALSO  for you!Are you a politician or kid who shouldn't be exposed to justified murder? The disclaimer says this game isn't for you.While most people seem to claim Postal 2 is the prime senseless dismemberment game on the market, the snarky and sadly believable storyline behind it all makes the violence you'll be tempted to dish out anything but senseless. (Either that, or I need to be sent to an asylum.) The combat is simple yet awesome once you learn how strong each weapon is, and you can always justify  invading random in-game homes and businesses  to get more firepower given how trigger-happy most of the residents are. The tons of difficulty levels will keep you coming back for more urine-soaked amputation-and-firearm to-do lists. (Seriously. A trip to the grocery store might involve slaughtering or avoiding masses of angry people.)Surgeon general's warning:  READ THE DISCLAIMER AS THE GAME LOADS . YOU SHOULD NOT USE THIS GAME AS JUSTIFICATION FOR REAL-LIFE VIOLENCE. (You could use it as a reason to whine about the modern world if you like as long as you're not going into politics, though.) Some later parts are counter-intuitive, but others make up for it by having multiple means to the same end. Some non-combat interactions are glitchy. If in doubt, equip your in-game money and hammer E. For item drop-box glitching, keep trying and they will eventually work. If you get stuck in the wall, this game is very good at getting you  un-  stuck, so be happy about that.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												This game is brilliant. It's humour is funny, graphics meh but it is a fairly old game. Mine had a glitch where no one actually carries guns just shovels, police batons, knuckle dusters, molitovs and (near the end) sledgehammers. It is quite random in terms of where you are and what happens, like you go to confess your sins at the church and it gets attacked by terrorists. My advice, always carry a weapon. I made the mistake of not taking a weapon to work on the first day and got killed by protestors. If you want to do everyday things but kill people, go for 'POSTAL 2'. If you want to kill zombies,  insane Gary Colemans (armed with scissors) and defeat the demon-cow big boss, then go for 'Apocolypse Weekend'. If you want the full feel of the game, go for 'A Week in Paradise'  (or something like that, I may be wrong).All in all, this is a great game and I seriously advise you to get it. :D

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 3, 2015
												Yeah, this game is very fun, but it's not without it's flaws. In this review, I will pick out specific parts of the game to talk about, and they may contain spoilers, so do not read if you do not want to finish playing. (Like this game has spoilers.)First, the game is very offensive to those who take offense to this sort of stuff. Now, I'm not one to be offended, so I had an enjoyable time playing this game. But some might find the stereotypes, the violence, and the overall mature oriented material of the game offensive. That said, they'd know what they're getting into with the content rating and the screenshots on the page.Secondly, the dialogue in this game is clear and can be heard pretty perfectly. However, they often repeat lines, which can get a bit annoying at times. I can't tell you how many times that I heard a pedestrian say "One side!" or the Postal Dude say, "You probably think I'm not a nice person," but I know that the count must be in the hundreds by now.Third, the combat in this game is great. However, without a cover system, the first person aspect was a bit tough to grasp and truly not take damage from anyone shooting at you. This made the apocalypse difficult for me, as I had a small amount of health. Also, the boss battles were frustrating, as they had a missile launcher and I had to stand back and shoot them.Honestly, I thought the weekend missions were some of the most repetitive missions I have ever played, and would rather not play through them again. I remember thinking I was almost done with the game at one point, but I had another 10 parts to go. It just jumped the shark too much at the end. The week was fine, I loved the week, but the weekend was just a roadblock to me. The bridge and Mike J. were some of the most frustrating parts of any game for me.Besides those complaints, I still think this is a very good game, and a very fun game. I'd recommend it to those looking for a dose of violence into their lives. Would I recommend it for the story? No, the story is almost non-existent. But the game is fine, and it's fun to just experiement what you can truly do in the game.And the multiplayer is fun. They remove a few weapons from the game, but the perk of playing the game with friends is a large fun perk.Rating: 7.5/10

												This game is abhorrently violent and senseless...  And that's why we love it so much.  It doesn't bother trying to be PC, it just lets you go...  Well, it lets you go postal!  I mean you don't HAVE to go around setting everyone on fire then♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥on their burning corpses or tazing someone until they're on the ground♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥themselves, only for you to decapitate them with a shovel...  But the option's there!Also let's not forget the fact that the game is still getting support and updates from it's developers long after release, and when you look at some other AAA games, they're left dead in the water after a few years.  All in all, good mindlessly violent fun, and it doesn't dare take itself seriously, because it knows you bloody well won't!

content:
Posted: June 16, 2015
												I bought this game in like 2004, but I figured I'd post a review anyway.  This game is pretty awesome the first time you play it.  It doesn't have much replay value, unless you're in the mood to run around and kill people.  I personally like to pee on peoples' faces, and then douse them with gasoline and light them on fire while they're puking.  Chopping people up is fun too.  The game only takes a few hours to beat, unless you make it a point to kill everyone you see along the way, which I did.  My only complaints worth mentioning are that there is only a somewhat small assortment of weapons and, thus limited ways to kill people.  Having something that could disembowel someone woulda been fun, for instance.  I could think of other ways to kill that'd be cool, but you get the point.  Also, being able to torture people in different ways would have been a good addition.  I wish violent games on the whole would get just a bit more nasty.  This game has the right idea.  Again, just wish there was a much larger variety of nasty stuff you could do to people.

content:
Posted: July 3, 2014
☭AH MAH GASH U CAN PEE ON PEOPLE. TENOUTTATEN!☭ Ahem. This review has been long coming. Postal 2 is an offensive to some, but if you can look past that you can really get some enjoyment out of this game. While the gunplay is average at best, the weapon variety is amazing. Scissors, Gas cans, Dynamite, Urine, Napalm Launcher, Sledgehammars etc. The story is simple. You are sent on errands by your nagging wife. It entirely up to you how you decide to behave. You can be a pacifist, not killing a single person using your wits and money to get out of arrest. Or for most players. You can go POSTAL. Gunning down all these people and rampaging through the town decaptating, burning, or otherwise maming your way through the game.  If it comes down to it, Would I reccomend? Yes.Some people are sensitive about a game like this, but you just need to listen up.Its low brow yes, but theres charm in that.Overall I enjoyed Postal 2 and if you bought it, you will too.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 17, 2014
												Postal 2 is a unique experience, containing amazing gameplay like no other.  It tells the story of a man who has to overcome his various mental problems through many different methods, showing the internal struggle through a week of his life.  It shows how some people with problems have to go through a struggle to simply get milk.  It feels like everyone is your enemy and you have to conquer them, very symbolic.  It contains daily menial tasks that have a lot of struggle.  It also shows a very realistic depiction of modern problems that we all face such as a bad economy, losing your job within the first day of working at it.  Truly the only game to match the symbolism and quality as a public statement on life that I have seen is the popular game "Gone Home".  Truly an artistic masterpiece that will bring you to tears with its storytelling.Also you can stick your gun in a cat's butt as a silencer and I laughed.  :)

												POSTAL 2 will make your mother cry and your friends question your lack of empathy.Just joking.It's not that bad.Considered one of the more offensive games out there, I found it to be quite light hearted. This is due to the fact that Postal 2 is NOT a serious game, and if it is, it certainly doesn't feel like one. The storyline is linear, there's no characters you'll likely care about, and the gunplay can become quite stale very quickly, even with the varity of weapons.Overall, however, it has it's moments: from lighting a marching band on fire to tazing dogs and flipping off dikes8.3/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 13, 2015
												This game is AMAZING!!!the game is dated but just like half-life, it's still really fun! You play as a man named the "Postal Dude" who gets chores from his naggy wife, like cashing a check at a bank. You could wait in line and get 25$ from you're check. OR go balls to the walls and get 500$ from pulling out your big♥♥♥♥♥shotgun and rob the place! As time goes on more and more people start to hate you and will randomly attack you on the side-walk. Eventually the military will come in and before you know it. The apocolipse happens and your running away from zombies and ebola cows! Yeah its kinda ♥♥♥♥ed up but its so ♥♥♥♥ed up its fun! One problem though. eatch day is harder than the last, and thats fine! But on day 4 and 5 you are walking from one side of the town to the next witch takes about 15 min. Its fine the first time I played it, But the second time it was so boaring to walk I just dropped it. still fun for new players though!-Pros-Badass postal dude-Choice between good or bad-guns, knives, and even more guns to weild!-ZOMBIES AND EBOLA COWS!!!-Bunch of other stuff!-Blah, Blah, Blah, JUST GET THE GAME!-Cool workshop and mods!-Cons-A little dated-you forgot to save so now you have to redo some stuff :/-more forgetting to save-walking simulator on the final daysAnyway, just get the game. Its mindless fun!

content:
Posted: November 1, 2015
												My first reaction to this game was: Hmmkay? Totally not weird to chop people's heads of, set them on fire and pee on their burning corpses. But later on in the game I started to enjoy the pixelated boobs, bloody limps and the puke staines on the ground. It is pretty pleasing to separate someones legs from their body in one nice and clean swing with your machete. Smashing the brains of a cow with a sledgehammer, in a way that you will find pieces five meters further is also very interesting, and especially tasty when you are eating while you are playing. The fact that you can put the barrel of your shotgun in a cat's posterior and use it as a silencer should be enough to make you buy this game.7,5/10

												Postal 2 is really quite an unique game, though uniqueness never garantees quality. at it's best, it is a rather cynical and blundering parody of video game violence, in similar vein to games like Harvester. but at it's worst it's a very mediocure first-person shooter ladened with bugs and poor design choices. there are a few good points however: the town you get to wander around is suprisingly detailed and can be quite enjoyable to explore and find secrets in. the NPC interaction is, while very awkward and disjointed, quite enthralling taking into account the time of the game's release. however, It's pretty hard to reccomend as an actual game, because once the novelty of being able to pour gasoline on a cat, set it ablaze with a match and then♥♥♥♥♥♥on it's charred gory carcass wears off, you then see for what the game really is: an abhorrent mess of offensive stereotypes and gratuitous violence. but I can recommend this game for the experience it offers. you may get more out of it that way. I would suggest going in not expecting much, you may be pleasently suprised... note the word MAY.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 23, 2015
												This is a game that's meant to enthuse the part of your mind that's obsessed with killing, bloodshed, and the occasional feeling that your cat may know what it is you plan to do with it as it reaches the 'not so entertaining' years of it's life, as well and to offend LITERALLY everybody.Postal 2 is THAT kinda game that's a sandbox, adventure, shooter, gibfest of a game that plays of the original Postal (where the differences are failry noticible from a graphics standpoint) where you are Postal Dude, the indescribably firm definition of what it means to be a psychopath, slaughtering everything that get's in his way; including but not limited to- Cats, Dogs, Elephants, Zombies, Humans, pretty much anything that has a vowel in it he'll give the death stare until he feels enough discontent that he'll slap it over and over again until he has the sudden relief that what he saw as a horrified image of someone giving him half-a-million middle fingers can't flip him off anymore; continuing on to the next mission doing the exact same thing.Anyways, you get your set amount of difficulties; Libermode which is the litteral definition of "almost too easy", average for those of you that seem to know the rainbow filled fun of the hack and slash everything genre, and "I hope there's enough room in heaven for how much I'm going to be dying over and over because of the crazed ice cream man with a spoon intent on bashing my skull in because I didn't order HIS particular special 'Rocky Road'". Through it all, you'll experience different sorts of people intent on making your day a living hell; Stereotypical Protestors, Stereotypical Police, Stereoty- y'know I'm gonna stop right there, everything in this game is stereotype, and to win you pretty much have to be king of the stereotypes and self proclaimed survivor of the zombie appocalypse.Aside from completing your run of the mill "Wacky Honey-Do" list scenarios, you don't have to necessarily have to do them all and go straight home before curfew, you can explore the Post-Apocalyptic world where you and the rest of the population (which will be exterminated because of Postal Dude's bravehearted decision to destroy humanity for his sole wellbeing) spend their lives. You can collect plenty of weapons, which are hiding mind you, that have different styles of attacking and methods of use- my favorite being the Scythe because I can run around with my clipboard shouting "Next" whilst slicing off another crainium to add to my Psycopath Stew ((TM) not really TM).TL:DR - Shooty Shooty Bang Bang, Decapitation and gibs galore, weapons that no normal person should use but does, sandbox style stuff, and if you couldn't pee enough in Duke Nukem or Deadpool, now's your chance for vengeance my friends. COVER THE WORLD IN YOUR TERRITORIAL BLANKET!

content:
Posted: June 25, 2015
												Postal 2 is a classic game. The game is painfully simple; you play each day in a week and every day you are given a list mundane of chores: buy milk, go to church, pick up laundry etc. Sounds boring right? Wrong! The town you live in is bat♥♥♥♥♥♥insane. Random firefights break out everywhere, taliban shows up to create mayhem and as the week progresses more and more groups want to kill you. How you want to play the game is up to you. You can finish the game without killing anyone or you can use a large array of weapons to murder everyone in sight. My favourite weapons are the boomerang machete and the cat-silencer shotgun. Yes you can shove a shotgun in a cats ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and the gun meows!If you are a fan of political incorrectness and excessive violence this game is a must buy!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 6, 2016
												This game is very amusing to say the very least. Good way to relieve stress after a long day of work. I could care less about the tasks they give you in the game because I often get side tracked from them and just go around and killing people. I'm pretty sure back in the day the graphics looked good since I remeber this game being released in early 2003. By today the graphics look quite blocky and outdated but that means nothing because I'm having so much fun. Sometimes you can even find stuff that aren't possible to get with just cheat codes alone. This game also makes exploring fun because who knows what you can find out there. Although since Apocalypse Weekend was released as a seperate expansion originally in early to mid 2005 the graphics by then looked quite dated especially with games like Splinte Cell: Chaos Theory or Battlefield 2 really pushing the envelope back then. The path in Apocalypse Weekend is quite linear so it can get quite boring after a while espcially when the enemies in that game were too easy to kill on average difficulty. I don't care if this game is offensive, I'd recommend this game any day. Please note that this game will crash every so often and sometimes it'll not launch after. Had to restart my computer every time almost which is midly annoying.

												If your seriously looking for older classic games, I HIGHLY suggest you get this.  I own 3 copies of this game and I still play it a bit to this day. Unlike games today, This game gives you a freedom of choice while putting you into a setting that is disurbing and quite amusing at the same time.   The game does have a twisted sense of humor. Yes, while It has no story. But the gameplay makes up for that by giving the players freedom. The recent update added a new spice to the game as well with some new weapons.That being said, the developers are extremely nice people. Postal 2 is 10 years old and had a huge update recently as mentioned before. I hope their "next project" goes well for them.

												Pretty fun game, but gets kind of monotonous after a while. When you first play it, you're like "Hey, this is funny! I'm♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥on people and putting a shotgun barrel through a cat's♥♥♥♥♥hahahaha funny" but after that, the humor kind of dies down, and you're basically over it after 2 minutes of seeing it. As far as the main objective goes in this game, it's really basic. You just go through the days of week doing errands, some of them being a little more catastrophic than others, but nonetheless just doing "every day" kind of tasks, that people normally do, with the exception that you can kill people on the way if you're feeling Postal haha. Overall though, the game is pretty fun for what it is. If you see it on sale, I definitely recommend picking it up.

												Yes, this game is offensive, controversial, and horrible. Yet, these seemingly unattractive qualities are exactly what makes this game so much fun to play. Anyways, Postal 2 is definitly worth the price and is a good game.

Probably because of some unique ways to kill and especially the♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥mechanic xD. Also some of the things that happen gave me a laugh and some of the things people and protagonist say are descent fun. Also I think Workshop can bring a lot more content to this game but I am yet to try it. Buy this game on a sale when it's under 5 euros in my opinion a little over liked title.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 16, 2014
												Postal 2 is obviously the sequel to Postal, however the only thing this game has in common are the title and the protagonist. There isn’t really a story in postal 2, you are just put into the shoes of the postal dude for two weeks where he moves to a fictional town in Arizona called paradise where he works for running with scissors. The gameplay is the main focus of this game, it’s a free roaming first person shooter where you have a series of non-violent tasks to do on your to-do list, such as: return a library book, or buy some milk. This is a game where it’s only as violent as you are playing it, you don’t have to kill a single person. Though the game will start testing your patience since some of the objectives involve queuing and the NPCs like to push in and most tasks usually have multiple ways of completing them. After each task is complete something usually goes horribly wrong and a group of lunatics show up with guns, and once this has been done these people will be marked on your map as a group of enemies who will shoot you on sight when you are wondering around. The exploration is handled quite well in this game, there are a lot of nooks and crannies where items can be found. Like I said earlier you can either be a pacifist or you can murder and torture as many people in as many ways as you want, since you have an arsenal filled with kitchen appliances, garden tools, sports equipment, firearms, and explosive and flammable equipment and each weapon is better for different situations. The violence in this game is so over the top that’s its quite funny. This is quite a funny game due to the crazy things that can happen in the game world but the humour is hit or miss, it ranges from cultural parodies, animal cruelty, absurd acts of violence and disgusting behaviour since you can♥♥♥♥♥♥into people’s mouths and they will throw up (you can also put fires out with♥♥♥♥♥♥, and breaking the fourth wall.   There are also over dozen difficulty modes, on the lowest difficulty the most powerful weapon the enemies will be armed with is the shovel, on insane-o mode everyone is armed with a random weapon and they will attack if they feel threatened instead of most people running away and screaming in a ridiculous manner, and on they hate me and above everyone is armed and will attack you on sight.  The only problem with this game is that it does crash fairly often due to a bug in the game, and it’s got quite a limited appeal since the violence and the offensive parodies can be huge off putters, when this game came out it received mostly negative reviews because of this and disregarding everything else in the game. So this is a really good game, with a lot of replay value and I suggest you play each one (Monday to Friday, and paradise lost) three times, one normally, one being a pacifist and one on postal mode.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2014
												The game is violent, politically incorrect and very bloody. Tools crimes are very diverse, from the ordinary Glock shovel until the napalm and rocket launchers. There are also tools which can deprive the opponent's limb or torso separated from the legs. Nevertheless, we can pass this game with no murder (!). The story talks about the man name's Postal Dude, who lives with his wife in a mobile home in a small town "Paradise". We are our hero for the full week. The tasks seem trivial, because what's so hard about putting a book to the library? It turns out that the people of the town will not allow that in the life of our hero crept into everyday life. In the game's under brutality we can see political motives, the game puts the unanswered questions and makes you think. This is still a good game, I love it.
